Help

This app lets you define exactly what records different users can see and work on. It's useful to restrict data visibility, enforce roles, and keep your business data secure.

What You Can Do

  • Assign a record to just one user (e.g. only one salesperson sees Customer ABC).
  • Allow multiple users to access the same record (like a project or item).
  • Restrict a user to single values (e.g. only one Supplier).
  • Assign multiple values to a user, covering a list of customers, projects, etc.
  • Apply rules to a specific doctype (like Sales Order), or to all doctypes where the record appears.
  • Decide if users should also see linked child records (like Tasks under a Project).

How to Fill This Form

  1. Users: Select one or more users in the table who should get these permissions.
  2. Doctype: Choose which type of document you want to restrict, e.g. Customer, Supplier, Project.
  3. Record(s): Pick the exact records (values) that the selected users can access.
  4. Apply to All Doctypes: Check if you want these permissions to apply everywhere the record is linked. Uncheck to limit to the selected doctype only.
  5. Hide Descendants: Turn this on if you want to block access to child records (like Addresses under a Customer).
  6. Save: When done, save the document. The rules will take effect immediately.
